<form id="module1_multia_q3"
  onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module1_multia_q3')" data-correct-answer="A">
<strong style="display: block;">Consider the following statements:</strong>

  <ol style="margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 10px;">
    <li>In a firm commitment IPO the underwriter makes a best efforts promise and does not guarantee sale</li>
    <li>In a best efforts IPO the underwriter guarantees sale of all shares at the offer price</li>
    <li>A best efforts deal can include an all or none clause</li>
  </ol>

  <strong style="display: block;">Which statements are FALSE?</strong>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q3" value="A"> A. 1 and 2</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q3" value="B"> B. 1 and 3</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q3" value="C"> C. 2 and 3</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q3" value="D"> D. All of them</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q3" value="E"> E. None of them</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module1_multia_q3" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: A. Statements (1) and (2) are false (statement (3) is true).
Why the false statements are false:
- (1) In a firm commitment IPO, the underwriter commits to buy the shares from the issuer and resell them—effectively guaranteeing the sale at the offer price.
- (2) In a best efforts IPO, the underwriter does not guarantee selling all shares; it only agrees to use its best effort to place them.
